intro: Zigadenus glaberrimus, commonly known as the nakedleaf death camis, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is known for its potent alkaloid toxins, which can be lethal to humans and animals. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact and ingestion of any part of the plant.
